name: overview
data:
[{"id":"91ecdd42-6796-4245-967c-ed56fb532d47","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Module and Dependency Metadata Outputs","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"91dd5bc3-186b-4f29-affc-d878ae6c7092","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This sub-group of methods is responsible for exporting the "Library" of code discovered during the analysis. Beyond just function calls, these methods provide context about the physical files (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Modules","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") that contain the code. This metadata is essential for auditing, as it allows users to distinguish between the code they own (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Internal","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and the third-party libraries they depend on (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"External","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4484bcbf-40c3-4cdc-a54d-0e74f20aa05d","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"6b290912-d1f8-4b9c-9c61-22f48f5bf180","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"76c80103-9958-4030-90bf-879a4f58e829","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"output_internal_mods()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Retrieves a dictionary of all modules found within the analyzed package root. For each module, it provides the file path (relative to the project root) and a list of all functions or methods defined within that file.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4d5c2cd2-0410-41ed-bad5-0592d4095ba3","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"output_external_mods()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Similar to the internal output, but specifically for third-party or library code encountered during the scan. This is used to understand the "surface area" of external dependencies the project interacts with.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bf4b1da0-026d-4ec3-8e48-f0735a5298d0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"_generate_mods(mods)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"An internal formatting utility used by both the internal and external output methods. It takes a dictionary of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects and transforms them into a serializable format:","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"9314fda4-da18-408b-95af-04820d3cd3ae","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"filename","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The relative path to the file on disk.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"21640861-3c18-4f0e-a1cd-4d58349f806c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"methods","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": A registry of method names found in the module, including their line number coordinates.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"86fa0608-a1e7-450b-a159-73ce20501498","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"2d697328-8f94-49ea-b29c-1c71e2fb95c7","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f864f072-65c7-4ba5-965c-a0caacc0dd4e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"These methods are used to generate the "Context" section of an analysis report.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4348062f-1847-4473-bacc-94d2f62f3ade","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# Generate a manifest of internal project code
internal_inventory = cg_gen.output_internal_mods()

for mod_name, data in internal_inventory.items():
    print(f"File: {data['filename']}")
    for method in data['methods'].keys():
        print(f"  - Found Method: {method}")

# Compare against external dependencies
external_inventory = cg_gen.output_external_mods()
print(f"The project depends on {len(external_inventory)} external modules.")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3a1e225e-a902-4b95-8d60-296778fad303","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bceba6a1-cd20-405e-8078-c487db81f111","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Serialization Friendly","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By converting internal ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects into simple dictionaries and lists, these methods prepare the data for easy export to JSON or YAML formats.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a41d25eb-4f9e-4ae1-ac19-129868c6035c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dependency Audit","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The distinction between internal and external modules allows security tools to apply different rules—for instance, ignoring vulnerabilities inside standard libraries while flagging them in local code.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"79f78e0b-1f12-4cff-8a93-79bd9c7791d0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Path Normalization","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The use of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"os.path.relpath","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the helper ensures that file paths are relative to the project root, making the final reports portable across different developer machines.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b1905780-694b-4ec5-bff9-2104d7b78831","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
